author: Juliano Galisi e Gabriel de Sousa
title: Oposi√ß√£o protocola pedido de impeachment de Lula por ligar a√ß√£o de Israel a holocausto - Not√≠cias - BOL
text:
Oposi√ß√£o protocola pedido de impeachment de Lula por ligar a√ß√£o de Israel a holocausto Bras√≠lia e S√£o Paulo
23/02/2024 15h12
A oposi√ß√£o ao governo protocolou o pedido de impeachment do presidente Luiz In√°cio Lula da Silva (PT) na C√¢mara. O requerimento, com 139 assinaturas, est√° na mesa de Arthur Lira (PP-AL), presidente da Casa, desde a noite de quinta-feira, 22. Encabe√ßado pela deputada Carla Zambelli (PL-SP), o requerimento deve passar por um aditamento para inclus√£o de mais cinco nomes.
O requerimento possui 49 p√°ginas e afirma que o presidente da Rep√∫blica cometeu "ato de hostilidade contra Israel" por meio de "declara√ß√µes de cunho antissemita". No √∫ltimo domingo, 18, Lula comparou a incurs√£o de Israel na Faixa de Gaza com o exterm√≠nio de judeus promovido pela Alemanha nazista.
A declara√ß√£o de Lula gerou uma crise diplom√°tica, fator elencado pelos autores do pedido. Segundo os parlamentares, o chefe do Executivo teria comprometido as rela√ß√µes comerciais entre Brasil e Israel e a neutralidade brasileira, crimes de responsabilidade tipificados pela Lei do Impeachment.
Por erro t√©cnico no protocolo do pedido, o requerimento que chegou na mesa de Lira abriga 139 assinaturas, sem acumular todos os signat√°rios da medida, segundo Zambelli. Nesta segunda-feira, 26, ser√° feito um aditamento para a inclus√£o das assinaturas dos deputados Pedro Lupion (PP-PR), Giacobo (PL-PR), Sargento Portugal (Podemos-RJ), Alex Santana (Republicanos-BA) e L√∫cio Mosquini (MDB-RO).
Zambelli quer incluir tamb√©m a alega√ß√£o de que Lula "procedeu de modo incompat√≠vel com o decoro do cargo", outro argumento para fundamentar o impedimento do presidente da Rep√∫blica. A deputada afirmou que ser√° realizado na semana que vem uma solenidade para o an√∫ncio oficial da iniciativa.
'Superpoder' de Lira
O pedido, a partir de agora, depende exclusivamente de Arthur Lira para avan√ßar. Segundo Fl√°vio de Le√£o Bastos, doutor em Direito Constitucional e professor universit√°rio do Mackenzie, o n√∫mero absoluto de assinaturas no requerimento, em si, "n√£o √© t√£o importante", apesar de indicarem mobiliza√ß√£o pol√≠tica.
No fim das contas, como ocorre a partir desta etapa, a abertura do processo de impeachment compete unicamente a Lira, "havendo 50, cem ou mil assinaturas", explica o professor. "√â um poder exclusivo, um 'superpoder', como alguns denominam, do presidente da Casa", disse Le√£o Bastos.
Zambelli quer que um ter√ßo da C√¢mara assine o pedido
Zambelli afirmou por meio das redes sociais que espera contar com mais ades√µes no requerimento. "Se Deus quiser vamos chegar a 171, que √© um ter√ßo da C√¢mara, um n√∫mero bastante expressivo", disse a deputada no X (antigo Twitter).
A maior parte dos deputados que aderiram ao pedido de impeachment √© filiada ao PL, partido do ex-presidente Jair Bolsonaro e principal legenda de oposi√ß√£o ao governo Lula. Mas at√© parlamentares de siglas que integram a base governista, como Uni√£o Brasil, PSD e MDB, constam entre os apoiadores do requerimento. Isso ocorre pois os partidos integram minist√©rios do governo federal, mas os deputados, a n√≠vel individual, atuam na oposi√ß√£o a Lula.

author: @kfvsnews
title: Tornadoes confirmed to hit southern Illinois during Wednesday‚Äôs storms
text: Tornadoes confirmed to hit southern Illinois during Wednesday‚Äôs storms SOUTHERN ILLINOIS (KFVS) - Multiple tornadoes have been confirmed to have hit southern Illinois during severe storms on Wednesday, May 8. According to the [ National Weather Service in Paducah](https://twitter.com/NWSPaducah), at least four tornadoes touched down on Wednesday. Storm survey teams found an EF1 tornado in Cora and Jackson County in southern Illinois. The tornado lasted from 12:01 p.m. to 12:03 p.m. The maximum wind speeds were 108 mph with a path length of 1.25 miles and a width of 100 yards. At this time, there is one reported injury and no reported fatalities. An EF0 tornado was confirmed to be in the Lake of Egypt area in Williamson County. The tornado lasted from 4:04 p.m. to 4:11 p.m. The maximum wind speeds were 80 mph with a path length of 6.61 miles and a width of 25 yards. At this time, there are no reported injuries or fatalities. On the [Jackson/Williamson County line, an EF1 tornado](https://www.kfvs12.com/2024/05/09/damage-near-jackson-williamson-co-line-consistent-with-ef1-tornado-nws-says/) was confirmed. The tornado lasted from 3:10 p.m. to 3:26 p.m. The maximum winds were 90 mph with a path length of 4.58 miles and a width of 50 yards. At this time, there are no reported injuries or fatalities. Storm survey teams also [found an EF1 tornado in Saline County](https://www.kfvs12.com/2024/05/09/parts-saline-county-heavily-damaged-during-severe-storms/). The tornado lasted from 4:13 p.m. to 4:30 p.m. The maximum winds were 95 mph with a path length of 7.83 miles and a width of 150 yards. At this time, no injuries or fatalities were reported. We will continue to update as more information becomes available. Copyright 2024 KFVS. All rights reserved.

author: Steven Ertelt
title: Mom Fights Oregon After State Prevents Her From Adopting Because She‚Äôs a Christian - LifeNews.com
text:
A single mother of five is fighting the Oregon Department of Human Services denying her adoption application due to her religious beliefs.
Jessica Bates, a Christian mom who lost her husband in a car crash six years ago, attempted to apply with the department to adopt children in 2022. Oregon officials denied Bates‚Äô application because her Christian beliefs would not allow her to ‚Äúrespect, accept, and support ‚Ä¶ the sexual orientation, gender identity, [and] gender expression‚Äù of the children in her care as the department‚Äôs adoption regulations require, according to a lawsuit brought by Alliance Defending Freedom.
The 41-page lawsuit explained that Bates hoped to adopt a ‚Äúsibling pair‚Äù that are both under the age of 10 and began applying in March 2022. Bates said that during the trainings for the adoption she ‚Äúrealized that her faith might conflict with some of the Department‚Äôs expectations for adoptive parents.‚Äù
During one of the trainings, an instructor noted that Oregon law required adoptive parents to ‚Äúaffirm‚Äù a child‚Äôs gender identity, sexual orientation and preferred pronouns, according to the lawsuit. Prospective parents are also barred from sharing beliefs that do not promote these values.
A lower court ruled against her and now Bates is appealing to the 9th Circuit to allow Bates to access Oregon‚Äôs adoption system free of discrimination while her lawsuit continues so that she can provide a loving home to children in need.
HELP LIFENEWS SAVE BABIES FROM ABORTION! Please help LifeNews.com with a donation !
‚ÄúNo state should abandon children in favor of a dangerous ideological agenda,‚Äù said ADF Legal Counsel Johannes Widmalm-Delphonse. ‚ÄúJessica is a loving mother who feels called to adopt siblings under the age of 10 from foster care. But the state of Oregon is categorically excluding her from adopting any child because Jessica shares a view held by millions of Americans: that boys and girls are biologically different and should cherish that difference, not reject it. Because Jessica will not promote Oregon‚Äôs radical gender ideology to children under the age of 10, the state considers her an unfit parent and has deprived hundreds, if not thousands, of children in Oregon‚Äôs system of the opportunity to be raised in a loving home. We urge the 9th Circuit to allow Jessica to continue her adoption journey and provide a loving home to children in need.‚Äù
Although Jessica repeatedly told ODHS officials that she would happily love and accept any child placed with her, officials still rejected her application, making her ineligible to adopt any child‚Äîeven children who share Jessica‚Äôs religious beliefs. ODHS‚Äôs policy needlessly penalizes Bates and many other people of faith for their religious views, compels parents to speak words that violate their conscience, and deprives religious families of equal protection of the law because of their faith.
Bates, who lost her husband in a car collision six years ago, is a mother of five children, ages 10 to 18. Inspired by the story of a man who adopted a child from foster care, Bates felt a calling to follow the biblical teaching to care for orphans. State officials, however, rejected her application because she refused to abandon her religious beliefs.

author: TOI Lifestyle Desk
title: GitHub chief faces extensive backlash after he said, "Use AI or..." - Times of India
text:
GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke has sparked a frenzy of controversy in the international developer community following his announcement that developers would need to adapt to artificial intelligence (AI) or exit the industry altogether.
Tired of too many ads? go ad free now Dohmke contended that AI is no longer a voluntary tool but a core competence for anybody working in software development. His stark message- "Use AI or quit coding", which he stated in his blog post on August 3, 2025, and was also posted on his LinkedIn account. What was his argument? Thomas Dohmke thinks the developer's job is experiencing a seismic shift. In his opinion, the transition is away from being a hands-on coding expert to being a "creative director of code," choreographing AI tools instead of writing every line by hand.
He believes, AI systems like GitHub Copilot will write most of the code, while humans concentrate on architecture, direction, and quality assurance.
He quotes his conversations with developers who are already deeply dependent on AI, reporting their work has been revolutionized by gains in efficiency and in solving higher-level problems. He forecasts that within two to five years, as much as 90 percent of code will be coded by AI, and so AI literacy will become a fundamental competency for the profession.
Is the push necessary? For Dohmke, the logic is simple: adopting AI early would keep them competitive, while delaying it might cause them to stagnate or become obsolete. He positions AI as a productivity accelerator, liberating developers from boilerplate code and giving them more time to focus on design and innovation. This isn't, he insists, about substituting for humans but redefining their role. Rather than spend too much time bogged down in syntax and debugging, next-generation developers will coach AI to create strong, efficient, and secure code ‚Äî a job that involves critical thinking, domain knowledge, and comprehension of how AI models work.
Tired of too many ads? go ad free now Backlash from the community Despite his intentions, the message has drawn sharp criticism. Many developers view it as unnecessarily combative and anxiety-inducing, especially in an industry already dealing with automation fears. The framing of ‚Äúembrace AI or quit‚Äù has been accused of being a scare tactic, suggesting a future where those unwilling or unable to adapt are simply discarded. It also draws critics' attention to the practical dangers. Code produced by AI may harbor bugs or security vulnerabilities, and relying on such code without adequate checks could introduce serious vulnerabilities. Others contend that forcing AI adoption so vigorously overlooks the value of human hands-on control and craftsmanship in coding. Credit: Linkedin Risks and benefits There is no question that AI solutions such as GitHub Copilot have proven quantifiable productivity gains, with certain research indicating a 50 percent decrease in time on mundane coding tasks.
For some, AI is a creative collaborator, suggesting ideas, detecting mistakes, and speeding up processes. Whether his words were intended to provoke or motivate, the dialogue it has generated is one the industry can't afford to ignore. Developers are presented now with a dilemma: embed AI deeply into processes or risk being displaced by those who do. For some, it's an inspiring challenge; for others, it's a corporate dictate that brooks little argument. The message is unambiguous: the age of AI-driven work, whether it's coding or writing, has arrived! The sooner we understand, the better it is for us, and those who are unwilling to accept it may find themselves on the outside looking in. text:

author: Il Resto del Carlino
title: Consegnati nuovi mezzi per il sociale
text:
Il progetto "Modena citt√† ad impatto positivo" prevede mezzi per disabili, defibrillatore, azioni di sensibilizzazione ambientale e un nuovo bosco urbano. Aziende locali contribuiscono all'iniziativa.
Due veicoli attrezzati per il trasporto di disabili e persone anziane non autosufficienti, un defibrillatore, azioni rivolte agli studenti del liceo Muratori San Carlo sulla sostenibilit√† ambientale e un nuovo bosco urbano
E‚Äô il progetto "Modena citt√† ad impatto positivo", coordinato dalla societ√† benefit PMG Italia e patrocinato dal Comune di Modena che ha avuto un suo primo momento di restituzione con la consegna dei mezzi avvenuta marted√¨ in piazza Grande e la cerimonia di ringraziamento in Sala di Rappresentanza alle aziende che hanno partecipato al progetto. Sono infatti una quarantina le realt√† imprenditoriali della citt√† e della provincia che hanno contribuito all‚Äôacquisto delle dotazioni e hanno ricevuto una targa dalle mani del Sindaco e dei rappresentanti di PMG.

author: Canadian Press
title: Truck carrying girders slams into Highway 99 overpass, halting traffic
text:
DELTA ‚Äî A truck carrying what appears to be heavy construction material has smashed into an overpass in Delta, British Columbia, shutting down the southbound lanes of Highway 99.
It's the latest in a rash of overpass collisions that prompted the province to announce harsher penalties for companies and drivers with repeat offences earlier this month.
Drive BC says the incident south of Vancouver has also blocked traffic in both directions on the 112th Street overpass.
Delta Fire and Rescue Deputy Chief Dave Wood says the crash caused a "secondary accident" involving another vehicle.
He says crews were called to the scene at 12:14 p.m. and he didn't know of any injuries.
Photos of the aftermath of the incident posted on social media show large girders on the bed of a truck with another laying across the highway along with other debris.
Provincial statistics say as many as 30 bridge strikes have happened on British Columbia's highways since 2021, with 16 of them reported last year alone.
The new rules, announced Dec. 14, include the requirement for dump-style vehicles to have in-cab warning devices by next June, telling drivers if their trailer hasn't been lowered.
Over-height vehicle fines will increase to $575, up from $115.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Dec. 28, 2023.
The Canadian Press

author: Poster
title: Alpha Heater: The Smart Way To Heat Your Space
text:
From the conceptualization to the execution phase, the journey of Order Alpha Heat has been paved with hard work, innovation, and unwavering commitment to excellence. This report elaborates on the emergence and evolution of Order Alpha Heat and its commendable contribution to the heating solutions market. Order Alpha Heat began its journey with a mission to revolutionize heating technology. The company identified a significant gap in the market, with consumers unable to access reliable, efficient, and affordable heat solutions. Leaning on their core value of placing the customer first, the Order Alpha Heat team set out to research, develop, and implement technological innovations aimed at meeting this critical consumer need.As pioneers in the heating solutions market, Order Alpha Heat the experts at
Order Alpha Heat took a unique approach by considering three fundamental aspects: efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and ecological impact. By prioritizing these factors, the entity promotes energy conservation while offering economic benefits to the end-users. Its products have a low-energy consumption rate, are environmentally friendly, and are designed to be affordable for every customer.Ensuring quality in every step has been pivotal to the success and prominence of Order Alpha Heat in the market. From raw materials, production processes, to customer service, high standards are maintained. The technological advances achieved by the company have not compromised the durability, reliability, or robustness of its products. Their focus on long-term operational efficiency benefits customers who enjoy extended usage of Order Alpha Heat products, resulting in substantial savings over time.Moreover, Order Alpha Heat has consistently placed a high emphasis on research and development. As firm believers in the power of progressive technology, they have invested a significant portion of the company‚Äôs resources into R&D. This commitment not only ensures their place as leaders in the heating solutions market but also ensures that customers receive consistently high-performing products. This ongoing development plays a vital role in maintaining the consumer trust that Order Alpha Heat has established over the years.Sustainability and environmental mindfulness are other aspects where Order Alpha Heat has left its mark. By integrating green technology into its operations, Order Alpha Heat creates systems that cause minimal environmental impact. This green approach has not only catalyzed the company's growth but has also positioned it as a socially responsible brand that cares about the future of the planet.The market reputation of Order Alpha Heat has been fostered by its exemplary customer service. The enterprise goes above and beyond to keep its customers satisfied, providing after-sales support, addressing queries promptly, and working continuously to improve their services based on customer feedback. This unwavering commitment to customer satisfaction aids in the establishment of long-term relationships, cementing their place as a trusted heating solution provider.In addition to its advanced products, and customer-focused approach, the corporate culture at Order Alpha Heat has contributed significantly to its growth. The organization's leadership fosters a culture of growth, innovation, teamwork, and continuous learning. Its ability to retain and attract top industry talent is a direct result of its engaging work environment, and ambitious, collaborative vision.From a humble beginning to shaping the heat solutions industry, Order Alpha Heat has proved that its commitment to innovation, customer satisfaction, and sustainability is a winning combination for success. As it continues to dominate the heating solutions market, one thing is clear - Order Alpha Heat's impact will endure, fueled by its commitment to quality, innovation, sustainability, and most importantly, its customers.
